Problem:
Consider a complex function defined by \\( z(t) = e^{iAt}z_0 \\), where A is a constant matrix and \\( z_0 \\) is the initial complex vector. We analyze the impact of an integral transformation defined by the function \\( h(z) = \\int_0^t e^{-iB\\tau}z(\\tau) d\\tau \\) applied at time t, with B also being a constant matrix.

If \\( h(z) \\) is applied to the evolving state \\( z(t) \\) at t = T, will the state after applying \\( h(z) \\) at T+Δt be the same as if no transformation was applied at t = T?
Explanation: The transformation \\( h(z) \\) modifies the trajectory of the state by integrating a transformed version of the state over time, changing the future state due to accumulation of past states modified by \\( e^{-iB\\tau} \\). This affects the subsequent evolution differently than just the natural progression under \\( e^{iAt}z_0 \\).
